Reviews.Title: Adequate for the Price
Reviews.Author: CO772ER@HKG
Reviews.Content: I just want to say beforehand, if you are considering this camera keep expectations in line with what you're paying. This is a bargain-priced point-and-shoot camera, so its functionality is quite basic. You get what most digital cameras nowadays come standard with. These include image stabilisation, various scene modes (auto, beach, indoors, night, portrait, etc), high megapixel count (10+, which is all that most people need, while this camera has 16MP) and optical zoom (8x for this camera). Having said that, I think this is actually a pretty good camera. I have a quality Canon powershot camera, and this Fuji JZ250 takes pictures that are just as good, if not a bit better. Granted, my Canon model is from 5-6 years ago. Image blur becomes an issue if you're shooting in low-light, without flash, and your hands tremble. But that's pretty much what you'd expect from most point-and-shoot cameras, expensive or not. Pictures can appear grainy as well if lighting is particularly inadequate. In daylight or good lighting I have not had blur issues like the previous reviewer. Pictures are quite sharp. I do have to note though, colours don't seem to be as vibrant as that taken with my mother's Panasonic Lumix. But then again, that was a pricey model, and what I have is a bargain Fuji. But don't get me wrong, my pictures are still what I'd consider adequate. Not bad at all.I do enjoy the 8x optical zoom. And as advertised, even with the zoom at 8x, the image stabilisation works well. I trembled my hands to test it, and the pictures still were blur-free. I tried it with low lighting, but there was blur as expected. Under these conditions however, as long as you're doing your level best to keep your hands still, the image stabilisation will work fine.And lastly, this camera is capable of shooting HD video. This is a VERY NICE feature. I filmed while walking through my apartment and outside and am pleased with the result.

Reviews.Title: Good little inexpensive camera!
Reviews.Author: Picture Lady "Babs"
Reviews.Content: For a camera that is inexpensive I was pleasantly surprized!  There definitely is a learning curve.  My first pix were not good.  The important thing is to follow directions - make sure you hold the button down only half way to focus on the subject.  THEN, snap the picture.  Once you get used to doing this, your pictures will be beautiful!After having an expensive point and shoot camera I could hardly believe that one can get so much for so little money.

Reviews.Title: good value,adequate performance
Reviews.Author: K. J. Arbitman
Reviews.Content: I am mystified by the poor reviews of this product. I purchased mine recently at a bargain price, with the intention of using it as a travel camera, in addition to my more expensive digital outfits. I have now tested it extensively, and it has performed very well, under most circumstances. Please note, that when you cram 16 megapixels onto a small sensor, you will get a very noisy image above ISO 400, so keep that in mind. Even with automatic lens motion suppression, at extreme telephoto lengths picture blur may occur if the camera is not braced.I have found that the lens is sharp, and the 8X from wide to telephoto is very usable...without in-camera processing, you will get some distortion at wide-angle, as was seen with film, and sometimes quite charming in effect.Yes, there is a yellow caste to the images on the display, but the images on your computer will be quite accurate.Novices to digital photography might try the program mode, which gives you access to the menu, which with one click gets you a choice of ISO,color, and white balance. In shooting mode, a click on the 4-way controller gets you flash modes, and exposure control.  These will help you control the color and look of your pictures, just like an expensive and heavy SLR, which is much to Fujifilms credit.In summary, I find the camera to be well built, have a sharp lens, take decent, and sometimes surprisingly good pictures, and be easy to use.My only complaint is that Fuji has decided to keep up with the megapixel race, and cramming 16 MP onto a small sensor hinders its low light (high ISO) performance.

Reviews.Title: Good outdoor, lousy indoor
Reviews.Author: how to get ahead
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Costco because it was on sale and I trusted the Fuji name.  It takes great outdoor pictures but indoor pictures are another story.  Yellow, blurry.  Inconsistent.  Sometimes nice pictures, sometimes blurry and yellow.  Returning it.

Reviews.Title: no bargain
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: this camera has several very nice features for an under-$130 camera.  I returned it after almost every shot was blurry, regardless of the settings.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, but can't zoom in - blurry
Reviews.Author: dane ryan anderson
Reviews.Content: Thought this would be a good value. If you are just looking for a cheap camera, its ok, but everything looked blurry when I took pics. returned.

Reviews.Title: Bad camera
Reviews.Author: Kei
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap camera but I can not take a beautiful picture. White was changed yellow. I took 10 pictures but I only got a nice picture.

Reviews.Title: i from venezuela... bad imagen quality
Reviews.Author: denny navas
Reviews.Content: the image quality was not what I expected. in darkness the flash is not powerful environment also clear pictures tend to go yellow. does not reflect the proper image color balance. really be disappointed to the point that preferred to buy a used samsung and gave me better results. I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Irene Thiry
Reviews.Content: i have not used it much yet but i like it so fare i works grate and i love that i dont have to get one from my dad to take pic when i wont

Reviews.Title: OK is about all I can say
Reviews.Author: sebie
Reviews.Content: I received mine as a work anniversary gift a few months ago (said value was around $110.00). It is a nice little camera for items that basically don't move. This is NOT the camera for moving objects, movies, concerts & other low light situations. Disappointed with it's "HD" video quality (image & sound) & zooming as well. The zoom is not smooth & thus distracting as you're trying to move in & out.My family & I are familiar with point & shoots (mainly Canons) & spent time going through & trying all it's settings. On the upside, its Lithium (NP-45A 3.7v) battery has made it through four rock concerts (recharged after each one - takes about an hour) one of which was 3 hours. We're usually near or at the stage & thus the camera is usually left on at the ready for a good portion of the event (we avg 250-350 pics & a few videos). It's bittersweet as it was a gift & hoped it would be an upgrade (mp & zoom) from my older camera.  I concur with what the others have said, you can do better. With that said, I'm off looking for a new camera while my old camera remains my go to guy.

Reviews.Title: Stop distribution of this train wreck!
Reviews.Author: PRM253
Reviews.Content: Similar to the other reviews, we had gotten this camera at Costco, but it time after time does not come through. In this case it's not the operator. No matter who took the photo, it was disappointingly blurry, on any setting. Even the micro pics we tried were difficult to take and didn't come out well. We are lucky enough to have had this camera when we had seemingly thousands of recent family events. The bridal shower, the birthdays, the wedding, the celebrations, all blurry. Thank God there were professional photographers...and everyone else who DIDN'T have this camera. It's pure garbage, it should be called Blurryfilm. Blurry picture after blurry picture.

Reviews.Title: Click-click-click-click during video recording
Reviews.Author: Manx Shearwater "Manx"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Bestbuy, and while testing out the 720p video feature in several contexts I found that the auto-focus intermittently adds a sequence of four clicks. This is unacceptable and I returned it and picked up an ELPH for $50 more.The low-light capability was also rather poor.

Reviews.Title: focus is clear pics are blurry in text mode
Reviews.Author: Sussana
Reviews.Content: Like the convenient battery charger, 8GB SD, crop, 10 sec. timer & SR mode. Someitmes the sports mode of kids playing was blurry, text mode was sharp until the shutter was pressed. It doesn't distinguish among red, orange, pink. Purple is blue. Indoor flash varies in intensity. Camera won't stand on end for timed shots. Video is great when it doesn't overexposed. I can't justify keeping it because I lost too many shots.  My Samsung L100 8mp -same price, was better.  but it got lost.

Reviews.Title: Skip this bargain
Reviews.Author: Mr. Picky
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at best buy for $50 on sale. Sometimes being cheap does not pay off. Very inconsistent pictures. When the button is pressed lightly before snapping the photo everything looks in focus on the screen, but as soon as it takes the picture, half the time its all blurry. Any type of motion seems to aggravate the problem. I will be dropping it off at goodwill the next time a make a trip there.

Reviews.Title: Mr Lovesexy
Reviews.Author: Mr. Lovesexy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a back up for my XP-50, I got more camera than I paid for. It only short coming to me is it's zoom range and flash can be stubborn at times. Battery life is good. Picture options are very good, although when I first got her I had yellowish picts it just took some adjusting, my pict's are now crystal clear. If you are looking for a good back up or a camera that can go in harms way (AKA your teens), this is a very good bet.

Reviews.Title: poor quality
Reviews.Author: sandy
Reviews.Content: bought it on sale for $55, but gave it back the next day, I took photos throughout the day and night, both indoors and out, every single picture came out grainy, even when set on a table the camera still couldn't take sharp pictures, better to stick with a canon. I would say it makes a good camera for kids, but not even an average one for regular users.

ProductInfo.Features:
3-inch LCD display
High Quality Fujinon 8x Optical Zoom Lens
16MP CCD
HD Movies (720p)
Li-Ion Battery
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix JZ250 Digital Camera
